alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 25 at 10:13PM PST until December 28 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM TUESDAY TO 9 AM PST THURSDAY... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THURSDAY TO 9 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, dangerous rip currents and breaking waves due to elevated surf. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 7 to 10 feet are expected Tuesday night into Wednesday. For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large and potentially damaging breaking waves of 10 to 15 feet with local sets to 18 feet are likely, along with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Tuesday morning. For the High Surf Advisory, from 9 PM Tuesday to 9 AM PST Thursday. For the High Surf Warning, from 9 AM Thursday to 9 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Powerful waves and strong rip currents will pose an exceptional risk of ocean drowning and damage to coastal structures like piers and jetties, especially Thursday through Saturday evening. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest surf during the warning period will likely be near Ventura Harbor. Coastal flooding and beach erosion will likely be more significant Thursday through Saturday, especially during times of high tide. A coastal flood advisory will likely need to be issued as we draw closer to the event due to this increased risk of more significant coastal flood impacts. This very large surf combined with relatively high tides of 6.0 to 6.7 feet may result in more significant coastal flooding and beach erosion.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other water side infrastructure. Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
